Description: Tondo sherd of Attic black-figured pottery band- or lip-cup; interior: black-figure decoration consisting of knee and foot with boot of male perhaps kneeling to right; at left, toe of another foot, to right and a circle in added red; at right, part of a possible wing; surrounding tondo, four bands, and alternating red and black tongues with very fine black lines between; exterior: glazed black.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The suffix "5" was added by the British Museum's Naukratis cataloguing project to distinguish the sherd from the other 1912.37 sherds.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 421, no. B659) (labelled 1912.37.11)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0537) (Phase 1)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
